statements: SELECT * FROM access_control_lists WHERE user_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
SELECT id, resource FROM access_control_lists WHERE permission = 'read';
SELECT * FROM access_control_lists WHERE resource LIKE '%document%';
SELECT id, user_id, permission FROM access_control_lists WHERE permission = 'write' ORDER BY user_id DESC;
SELECT permission, resource FROM access_control_lists ORDER BY permission ASC, resource DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT id, user_id, resource, permission FROM access_control_lists WHERE id = 'd073371b-7a86-4b27-b98e-476577b69b6a';
SELECT * FROM access_control_lists WHERE user_id = '6488884e-4e2a-4c7b-8eab-9d27f16e4377' ORDER BY resource ASC;
SELECT DISTINCT user_id FROM access_control_lists WHERE permission = 'read' AND resource LIKE '%file%';
SELECT user_id, COUNT(*) AS total_permissions FROM access_control_lists GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY total_permissions DESC;
SELECT resource, COUNT(*) AS num_resources FROM access_control_lists GROUP BY resource HAVING COUNT(*) > 1 ORDER BY num_resources DESC;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT username, email FROM users ORDER BY username ASC;
SELECT user_id, email, username FROM users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM permissions WHERE perm_id = 3;
SELECT permission_name, description FROM permissions ORDER BY permission_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT username, email FROM users WHERE email LIKE '%@gmail.com';
SELECT user_id, username, p.permission_name FROM users u INNER JOIN permissions p ON u.user_id = p.perm_id;
SELECT user_id, username, email FROM users WHERE username LIKE '%admin%' ORDER BY user_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM permissions WHERE description IS NOT NULL LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM Users;
SELECT user_id, username FROM Users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT username FROM Users WHERE user_id = 2;
SELECT * FROM Permissions ORDER BY permission_name DESC;
SELECT user_id, COUNT(permission_id) AS num_permissions FROM User_Permissions GROUP BY user_id;
SELECT username, password FROM Users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM Users WHERE username = 'admin' AND password = 'admin@123';
SELECT permission_name FROM Permissions WHERE permission_id = 2;

SELECT Users.user_id, Users.username, Permissions.permission_name FROM Users JOIN User_Permissions ON Users.user_id = User_Permissions.user_id JOIN Permissions ON User_Permissions.permission_id = Permissions.permission_id;
SELECT Users.username, COUNT(*) AS num_permissions FROM Users JOIN User_Permissions ON Users.user_id = User_Permissions.user_id GROUP BY Users.username HAVING num_permissions > 1;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT username, role_name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id;
SELECT * FROM roles WHERE role_name LIKE 'admin%';

SELECT user_id, permission_name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id JOIN permissions ON roles.role_id = permissions.permission_id;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users ORDER BY user_id DESC;
SELECT user_id, role_name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id;
SELECT user_id, username, role_name FROM users LEFT JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id LEFT JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id;
SELECT user_id, COUNT(role_id) AS role_count FROM user_roles GROUP BY user_id;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT username, email FROM users WHERE id = 1;
SELECT roles.name, permissions.name FROM roles JOIN permissions ON roles.id = permissions.role_id;
SELECT users.username, roles.name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.id;
SELECT * FROM access_control_lists WHERE resource = 'user' AND role_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY last_name ASC
SELECT u.name, r.role_name FROM users u INNER JOIN user_roles ur ON u.id = ur.user_id INNER JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.id WHERE r.role_name = 'Admin'
SELECT u.name, p.permission_name FROM users u INNER JOIN user_roles ur ON u.id = ur.user_id INNER JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.id INNER JOIN permissions p ON r.id = p.role_id WHERE u.id = 1
SELECT * FROM roles WHERE role_name = 'Manager' OR role_name = 'Admin' ORDER BY role_name DESC
SELECT u.name, COUNT(*) AS num_roles FROM users u INNER JOIN user_roles ur ON u.id = ur.user_id GROUP BY u.id HAVING num_roles > 1
